content.raw: I am sorry for misunderstanding - I read the "SubT_Challenge_Competition_Rules_Tunnel_Circuit.pdf" now, so the RF communication to the base station is also limited (in the extreme case the robot has to return from tunnel in order to transmit position of detected artifacts). Nevertheless I suppose that there could be "a device" attached to the robot, talking via ROS messages and sending/failing to transmit data depending on the robot location/orientation?
content.html: I am sorry for misunderstanding - I read the "SubT_Challenge_Competition_Rules_Tunnel_Circuit.pdf" now, so the RF communication to the base station is also limited (in the extreme case the robot has to return from tunnel in order to transmit position of detected artifacts). Nevertheless I suppose that there could be "a device" attached to the robot, talking via ROS messages and sending/failing to transmit data depending on the robot location/orientation?
